intro: Malvastrum coromandelianum f. breviaristata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mallow, is a flowering plant characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy pink to purple flowers. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its compact growth habit and attractive blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
